educational.title: Why Your Fridge is Running But Not Cooling
educational.hook: Hearing your fridge run but food's getting warm? Here's the likely culprit.
educational.body: Most people don't know that condenser coils get clogged with dust and pet hair, making your compressor work overtime without actually cooling. Show the coils at the back or bottom of your fridge - see all that buildup? That's costing you money right now. While cleaning helps, if it's been years, the compressor may be damaged. We see this daily - a $150 coil cleaning could have prevented a $800 compressor replacement. The second issue? Faulty door seals. Do the dollar bill test - close a bill in the door, if it slides out easily, cold air is escaping 24/7.

educational.title: The Washer Smell Nobody Talks About
educational.hook: Your washer is supposed to clean clothes, so why does it smell like a swamp?
educational.body: Front-load washers have a hidden trap - the rubber gasket creates a perfect mold habitat. But here's what appliance companies don't tell you: it's not just the gasket. There's a filter trap that catches everything from coins to hair to detergent sludge. We pull out handfuls of this stuff every single day. The smell transfers to your 'clean' clothes. Running cleaning cycles helps temporarily, but if you're smelling mildew, the damage is deeper - in the drum, the pump, even the drainage system. We've seen washers less than 2 years old with serious buildup.

educational.title: Dryer Taking Forever? It's Not What You Think
educational.hook: If your dryer needs two or three cycles, you're wasting $30+ monthly on electricity.
educational.body: Everyone cleans the lint trap, but 90% of people don't know about the exhaust vent. This 4-inch tube from your dryer to outside gets packed with lint, creating a fire hazard and killing efficiency. We've pulled out lint blocks 6 feet long. But here's the real issue - even with a clean vent, your heating element or moisture sensor might be failing. A dryer pulling air properly should dry a full load in 40-50 minutes, max. If yours takes longer, something's wrong. The cost to run an inefficient dryer for a year exceeds the repair cost.
